fast3d.simple

Class SimpleUniverse

  • java.lang.Object
    • fast3d.simple.SimpleUniverse
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Universe

    public class SimpleUniverse
extends java.lang.Object
implements Universe
    a default implementation of universe
    Author:
    Tim Trense

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      SimpleUniverse()
      generates an empty universe

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void add(Renderable... r)
      synchronized variant to objs.add()
      all renderables are asked for their vertices which than are stored in an internal list
      void addLight(Light l)
      should be synchronized
      void enableDefaultLighting()
      a very dark gray ambient light, a directional light (vector -1,-1,-1) full bright white and a specular light (same vector, light gray) are added
      void enableFullLighting()
      adds an ambient light with full bright white color
      boolean equals(java.lang.Object obj)
      compares this with the parameter and returns false if the parameter is not of the same type
      Camera getCam() 
      Light[] getLights()
      synchronized implementation to provide all light-sources to the rendering process
      Renderable[] getObjs()
      sometimes it may be useful to have all Renderables at one time as array
      Renderable[] getObjsSorted()
      to render all objects, it is necessary to order them by distance to the camera
      the best way of sorting is detected automatically
      java.util.List<Vector3d> getVertices() 
      void invalidateLights()
      for all Illuminatables invalidateLight() is called
      java.util.Hashtable<Renderable,Vector3d> rayTrace(Vector3d s, Vector3d r)
      1)on a picking-action on the holding panel3d this method is called to determine, which Renderables may be targeted
      2)on a lighting-calculation the lighting-method will call rayTrace to determine whether some rays of light my be obstructed and now some objects lay in the shadow
      this method should call rayTrace for every Renderable that is in the universes internal storage and list the Renderables which return not null from that method in a result-list
      void remove(Renderable... r)
      synchronized variant to objs.remove()
      all renderables are asked for their vertices which than are removed from an internal list
      void removeLight(Light l)
      should be synchronized
      java.lang.String toString()

      • getObjsSorted

        public Renderable[] getObjsSorted()
        to render all objects, it is necessary to order them by distance to the camera
        the best way of sorting is detected automatically
        Specified by:
        getObjsSorted in interface Universe
        Returns:
        a sorted list of all Renderables in the universe

      • getObjs

        public Renderable[] getObjs()
        sometimes it may be useful to have all Renderables at one time as array
        Specified by:
        getObjs in interface Universe
        Returns:
        an array of all renderables at time of call

      • rayTrace

        public java.util.Hashtable<Renderable,Vector3d> rayTrace(Vector3d s,
                                                         Vector3d r)
        Description copied from interface: Universe
        1)on a picking-action on the holding panel3d this method is called to determine, which Renderables may be targeted
        2)on a lighting-calculation the lighting-method will call rayTrace to determine whether some rays of light my be obstructed and now some objects lay in the shadow
        this method should call rayTrace for every Renderable that is in the universes internal storage and list the Renderables which return not null from that method in a result-list
        Specified by:
        rayTrace in interface Universe
        Parameters:
        s - start of ray
        r - direction of ray
        Returns:
        all Renderables which are targeted by the ray and their puncture point with the ray

      • getCam

        public Camera getCam()
        Specified by:
        getCam in interface Universe
        Returns:
        a reference to the used camera to render the universe

      • getLights

        public Light[] getLights()
        synchronized implementation to provide all light-sources to the rendering process
        Specified by:
        getLights in interface Universe
        Returns:
        any form of light used to illuminate the universes Illuminatables during rendering process

      • addLight

        public void addLight(Light l)
        Description copied from interface: Universe
        should be synchronized
        Specified by:
        addLight in interface Universe

        Parameters:

      • enableFullLighting

        public void enableFullLighting()
        adds an ambient light with full bright white color

      • enableDefaultLighting

        public void enableDefaultLighting()
        a very dark gray ambient light, a directional light (vector -1,-1,-1) full bright white and a specular light (same vector, light gray) are added

      • invalidateLights

        public void invalidateLights()
        for all Illuminatables invalidateLight() is called
        Specified by:
        invalidateLights in interface Universe
        See Also:
        Illuminatable.invalidateLight()

      • getVertices

        public java.util.List<Vector3d> getVertices()
        Returns:
